titleStmt.title: E. Lagern et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG9025

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
To his Excellency
James F. Robinson Gov. of Ky.

The undersigned citizens in and near the Poplar Plains in Fleming County Kentucky state that they are personally acquainted with William Beaucamp and have known him for ten or twelve years -- that Beaucamp is a peaceable orderly man -- But a man of spirit and will resent insult and wrong -- He is and always has been a true and law-abiding man and decidedly for the preservation of the national Union -- He is a mechanic and has a family to support and raise by his labor -- We also knew John Keithly some of us personally and some by reputation and he is a man of very bad character -- reputed to be an outbreaker in almost every way -- We understand that Mr. Beaucamp desires to remove to the state of Illinois but before he can go he wishes to get rid of two Indictments against him one for cutting John Keithley and the other for carrying concealed a deadly weapon -- We believe Mr. Beaucamp has stated the facts in his petition to your Excellency which will be sent with this and we most earnestly pray your Excellency to reprieve said Beaucamp from said Indictments.

E. Lagern
N F Hurst
William B Hendricks
Ayres Leforgee
D W Litser
J N. Armstrong
James H Hurst
A J Emmams
John Clark
Robert D. Howe
R. P. Samuel
William Fleming
